entry.title: Light, Sleep, and Recovery Rituals
entry.summary: Small light habits that deepen sleep and improve recovery.
entry.content:
Your sleep system is light-driven. When light is right, hormones follow.

Morningâ€‹

  • 5â€“10 minutes of outdoor light within an hour of waking.
  • Keep caffeine for after your first light exposure.

Eveningâ€‹

  • Dim overhead lights 2 hours before bed.
  • Use warm lamps and avoid bright screens.

Nightâ€‹

  • Keep the room cool and dark.
  • If you wake, use low red light only.

If you want help dialing this in, I can build a simple light map for your home.

entry.title: Training for the Long Game: Strength + Aerobic Base
entry.summary: Build a body that lasts by pairing strength with easy aerobic work.
entry.content:
Longevity training is not extreme training. It is repeatable, joint-friendly, and still powerful.

Two anchorsâ€‹

  1. Strength: 2â€“3 full-body sessions per week.
  2. Aerobic base: 2â€“4 sessions of easy, nasal-breathing cardio.

What this buildsâ€‹

  • Muscle as metabolic armor
  • Mitochondrial density and stamina
  • Faster recovery between life stressors

If you want a start, try two strength days and two 30-minute zone-2 sessions for three weeks.

entry.title: Fasting Rhythms: A 7-Day Cycle You Can Repeat
entry.summary: A weekly template that balances metabolic flexibility with performance.
entry.content:
Fasting is a tool, not a religion. The goal is flexibility: the ability to burn fat, use glucose, and recover well.

A simple weekly rhythmâ€‹

  • Monâ€“Thu: 14â€“16 hour overnight fasts, protein-forward first meal.
  • Fri: Early dinner, gentle 12-hour fast to protect sleep.
  • Sat: Fuel for sport or training; no intentional fast.
  • Sun: Optional 18â€“20 hour reset if energy and mood feel steady.

Notesâ€‹

  • Hydrate with minerals during longer fasts.
  • Keep training intensity lower on longer fast days.
  • Refeed with protein, fiber, and whole-food carbs.

If this feels good for two weeks, we can personalize with biomarkers and training load.

entry.title: The Biohacking Compass: Earth, Sun, Forest, Water
entry.summary: A simple framework to guide daily decisions for long, healthy living.
entry.content:
Biohacking works best when it is grounded. I use a simple compass that mirrors nature: earth, sun, forest, and water. Each element points to a daily practice that keeps health simple and sustainable.

Earth: foundationsâ€‹

Strong sleep, consistent meals, and stable energy are the bedrock. If anything feels off, we reset here first.

Sun: timingâ€‹

Light tells every cell in your body what time it is. Morning sunlight, evening dimming, and movement outdoors create effortless alignment.

Forest: adaptationâ€‹

The forest is diverse and resilient. We train the same way by rotating modalities: strength, aerobic base, mobility, and skill.

Water: recoveryâ€‹

Hydration, minerals, breathwork, and cold exposure are the recovery river. When the water flows, stress drains.

If you want a simple start, pick one action from each element and repeat for a week. Your body will tell you what to keep.
